pageContext.claim: “This isn't about the straits. Do you know that China gets 91% of its oil from the straits? We don't even need the straits.”
pageContext.analysis: The source of Trump's claim that China imported 91 percent of its oil via the Strait of Hormuz is unclear. It appears to be incorrect, however. China’s General Administration of Customs says that China secured about 44 percent of its imported crude oil supplies via the Middle East from January through to April. China's biggest oil supplier in 2018 was Russia, which supplied 15.8 percent, followed by Saudi Arabia (12.4 percent) and Angola (10.4 percent.)
